author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
Expressing their determination to host JNU Students’ Union leader Kanhaiya Kumar in Pune despite threats from rightwing outfits, journalism students of the Savitribai Phule Pune University and students from Fergusson College have now formed a forum to take forward their objective of making “progressive ideas heard” in the city.

The forum, called the ‘Students’ Joint Forum,’ has also received the backing of the FTII Students’ Association. With its immediate objective of hosting a talk by Mr. Kumar in the city, the forum will attempt to ensure that progressive ideas do not get “stifled by the tyranny of the Right in Maharashtra,” the students said.

Members of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) have allegedly threatened the journalism students with dire consequences if they attempted to host Mr. Kumar.

On Sunday, the forum took on Pune University Vice-Chancellor Vasudeo Gade following the latter’s appeal to students not to disturb the peace of educational institutions.
title: Pune varsity students firm on hosting Kanhaiya talk
